name: jettison
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to get rid of something or someone that is not wanted or needed: The station has jettisoned educational broadcasts.
to decide not to use an idea or plan: We've had to jettison our trip because of David's accident.
to throw goods, fuel, or equipment from a ship or aircraft to make it lighter: The captain was forced to jettison the cargo and make an emergency landing.
